definition: causing something without any direct or apparent effort, shape or influence
details:
noun
- causing something without any direct or apparent effort
- a power to affect persons or events especially power based on prestige etc
= example: a power to affect persons or events especially power based on prestige etc
- a cognitive factor that tends to have an effect on what you do
= example: a cognitive factor that tends to have an effect on what you do
- one having power to affect or change the opinion and viewpoint of another
= example: one having power to affect or change the opinion and viewpoint of another
- the effect of one thing (or person) on another
= example: the effect of one thing (or person) on another
verb
- shape or influence
= synonyms: shape
- induce into action by using one's charm
= synonyms: charm, tempt
- have and exert influence or effect
= example: have and exert influence or effect
= synonyms: act upon
